p: Sex ratio at birth is also sensitive to changes in the environment. For instance, natural calamity can lead to a decrease in the male birth rate. The Kobe earthquake in January 1995, where thousands of lives were lost and many thousands became homeless, correlated to low male birth rates during that year [ 48]. The terrorist attack of September 11, 2001, and the great recession of 2007 also resulted in decreased male childbirth [ 49, 50].
